decks.notes: This deck revolves around using ramp spells and mana acceleration to quickly bring out powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths. It also focuses on controlling the board with removal spells like Unholy Heat and Kozilek's Command, while generating value with cards like Malevolent Rumble. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and disruption, using the abundance of colorless mana provided by Eldrazi Temple and Ugin's Labyrinth to gain an advantage and dominate the game.

The deck focuses on quickly swarming the board with low-cost creatures and artifacts, utilizing The Underworld Cookbook to provide card advantage and fuel the graveyard. Assembling a critical mass of artifacts enables powerful synergies with cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga, while Monument to Endurance provides resilience against removal. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Ovalchase Daredevil offer recursion and value, while Golbez, Crystal Collector and Psychic Frog provide disruptive elements. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive strategy fueled by a combination of creature beatdown and artifact synergy.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to use a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful creatures to control the board and eventually overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Fell the Profane to disrupt the opponent's game plan, along with powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Psychic Frog to apply pressure and generate card advantage, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent until it can secure a victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Phelia and Phlage to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Quantum Riddler and Consign to Memory. March of Otherworldly Light provides a way to protect your creatures and push through damage, while Fable of the Mirror-Breaker can act as a finisher. Teferi, Time Raveler helps control the tempo of the game and protect your board, while Arid Mesa and other lands provide mana fixing. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage as efficiently as possible. The diverse range of colors allows for flexibility in casting spells, while the Leyline cards provide additional support for the player's strategy. The inclusion of powerful cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Teferi, Time Raveler gives the deck extra firepower and control options. The goal is to apply constant pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a swift victory.

This UW Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while maintaining card advantage and controlling the board. It includes a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw effects, along with powerful planeswalkers like Narset and Teferi. The deck aims to control the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent through efficient removal and card advantage engines. By utilizing cards like Solitude and Wrath of the Skies, this deck can deal with threats efficiently while setting up for powerful win conditions like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful Eldrazi creatures and utilizing the UrzaTron lands to accelerate mana production. By combining disruptive cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Karn, the Great Creator with powerful threats like Sire of Seven Deaths and Devourer of Destiny, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and overpower them with big creatures. With a mix of removal spells and mana-ramp cards, the deck seeks to establish dominance on the battlefield and overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By playing powerful threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Scion of Draco alongside disruptive spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial, the deck can apply pressure and control the game. Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact help protect and enhance the creatures on the battlefield, while Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption. With a mana base that includes fetchlands and a variety of multicolor lands, the deck can consistently cast its spells and maintain its aggressive strategy.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly take down the opponent's life total. The deck includes powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, along with burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to finish off opponents. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls provide additional creature support, while Seasoned Pyromancer helps refill your hand. The deck also includes some utility cards like Thraben Charm and Blood Moon to disrupt opponents' strategies. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent and efficient casting of spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and burn spells to apply constant pressure on the opponent, while also having access to powerful removal options like Solitude and Thraben Charm. The deck aims to quickly build up a board presence with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, while also maintaining control with cards like Static Prison. The inclusion of Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory also provides additional ways to close out the game quickly. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells.

This deck focuses on leveraging powerful creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and pressure the opponent, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck also has a strong element of tempo play, utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to maintain pressure while disrupting the opponent's resources. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive playstyle, with a mix of fetchlands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to all colors of mana.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence by playing low-cost artifact creatures and utilizing cards like Urza's Saga and Mishra's Bauble to generate value. The deck also includes artifact-based removal options like Engineered Explosives and Aether Spellbomb, as well as disruption with Tormod's Crypt and Metallic Rebuke. By utilizing cards that can both generate resources and disrupt the opponent, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive plays while controlling the game tempo.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on utilizing cheap creatures with prowess and other aggressive abilities, along with efficient burn spells, to quickly overwhelm and outpace the opponent. The deck aims to quickly build up a board presence and apply pressure with cheap spells and creatures, while maintaining card advantage with cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration. The inclusion of Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge provide ways to protect and pump up key threats, allowing for explosive turns and surprise finishes.

This deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays, utilizing cheap and efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear to deal damage early on. Supporting spells such as Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Mutagenic Growth help to control the board and push through damage. The deck also aims to trigger prowess abilities consistently by casting multiple spells in a turn. The inclusion of Mishra's Bauble and Slickshot Show-Off provides card advantage and additional damage potential. The mana base is designed for consistency and flexibility, allowing for fast starts and multiple color options.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing the powerful UrzaTron lands and Eldrazi creatures. By ramping up mana with Expedition Map and Mind Stone, the deck can quickly cast threats such as Devourer of Destiny and Thought-Knot Seer. Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms provide additional control elements and the ability to shut down opponent's strategies. The deck focuses on using its high mana resources to dominate the battlefield and outvalue the opponent.
